name: "Supergirl" Season 1 Episode 2 Trivia Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the opening scene what was the military doing?
options: Attacking Supergirl because she was a threat to security
questions.explanation:
Testing Supergirl's powers.

	Early in the episode Supergirl is shown being struck by missiles and other military hardware.  Because she is only recently out as a superhero, they are testing the limits of her powers to see how strong she actually is.

questions.text: Supergirl's first big save of the episode was doing what?
options: Stopping a car from falling off a bridge.
Rescuing a kitten out of a tree.
questions.explanation:
Putting out a large fire.

	Supergirl went from the training session with the military straight to the National City Port to put out a large fire. After the events of the first episode everyone expected her to be just like her cousin, Superman, but as those who saw her attempt to put out the fire, she still had a lot to learn.

Massive oil spill.

	While at the National City Port Supergirl grabbed a large tanker ship, and in doing so ripped a hole in the side of it. About 100 million barrels of oil (Yeah that seems like a like, but it was the number on the news in the episode) spilled into the harbor. Supergirl may have super powers, but she doesn't yet have control over those powers.

questions.text: Who did Cat Grant put in charge of tracking down Supergirl for an interview?
questions.explanation:
The entire CatCo staff.

	Now that Supergirl has come out of hiding and burst onto the scene as a hero in town, Cat Grant wants the exclusive interview. She tasks the entire staff to beat the "Daily Planet" to the punch and score an exclusive with Supergirl by the end of the week.

questions.text: How did Alex Danvers manage to best Supergirl in a fight?
questions.correct: She used a Kryptonite Emitter set at 18 percent.
options: They fought under a red-light in a sealed room.
She used a Kryptonite Emitter set at 18 percent.
questions.explanation:
She used a Kryptonite Emitter set at 18 percent.

	Alex worked for the Department of Extranormal Operations, a secret government organization that officially did not exist. That organization had stores of Kryptonite to use to battle escaped Kryptonian prisoners. They also used it to help train Kara to fight.  The device she used was strapped to her wrist and let off large dosages of Kryptonite.

questions.text: What was Cat Grant's first job in the media?
questions.explanation:
Perry White's assistant.

	"I worked hard until I got a chance to write gossip." It was as a gossip columnist that she made a "name" for herself before becoming a media mogul. But it was as Perry's assistant that she first got a taste of what it was like to be in the business. After working at the "Daily Planet" for Perry, she moved to National City to start her own empire.

questions.text: Supergirl saved an animal from a tree, what kind of pet was it?
questions.explanation:
Snake.

	The snake was named Fluffy. Supergirl and her friends decided that after a series of blunders she needed some positive publicity. So she went on a crusade to make small saves and improve her public image, including saving animals out of trees.

questions.text: What song was playing over the montage of Supergirl working on her public image?
questions.correct: Hit Me With Your Best Shot
questions.explanation:
Hit Me With Your Best Shot.

	"Hit Me With Your Best Shot" sung by Pat Benatar played over a montage of Supergirl making a few smaller saves than would be expected by someone with her powers. The montage was about three minutes long, showing several events that made the public fall in love with her again.

questions.text: What fictional alien species was the "big bad" in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Hellgrammite.

	The Hellgrammite, who was near indestructible, ate DDT.  DDT is an odorless tasteless crystal used in many pesticides. Superman had to step in and save Kara during her first fight with him. Alex Danvers ended being the one who took down the Helgermite, proving that humans aren't powerless after all.

questions.text: Did Supergirl give anyone from CatCo an interview?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	Midway through the episode Cat told James Olsen that if he didn't land the interview he would be fired. Kara and James were fast becoming friends, so she granted Cat the interview at the end of the episode. She grabbed the car that Cat was inside, and flew it up to the roof of the CatCo building.
